member.name: T:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.ColorPalettePanel
member.summary: Control for displaying a .

remarks.para: The palette is displayed as a series of color swatches. Swatches auto-fill available space left-to-right and top-to-bottom. The swatches will auto-scroll as needed.
The user can click on a color swatch to select its color.

member.name: F:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.ColorPalettePanel.SCROLLBAR_WIDTH
member.summary: Width of vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.ColorPalettePanel.SWATCH_WIDTH
member.summary: Width and height of each color swatch.

member.name: E:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.ColorPalettePanel.ColorChanged
member.summary: Triggers when the user selects a color.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.ColorPalettePanel.#ctor(WithoutHaste.Drawing.Colors.ColorPalette,System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenu)
member.param: Optional context menu to apply to each color swatch.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.ColorPalettePanel.DisplayColors(WithoutHaste.Drawing.Colors.ColorPalette)
member.summary: Set the color palette to display in the panel.

member.name: T:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.EditPaletteDialog
member.summary: Control for editing a .
member.remarks: This dialog will open an existing palette file (or create an empty palette), let the user edit the palette, and save the changes before closing.

member.name: P:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.EditPaletteDialog.FullFilename
member.summary: Location of color palette file, including full path + filename + extension.
member.remarks: If palette is saved to a new location, this property will have the new location after the dialog closes.

member.name: P:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.EditPaletteDialog.ColorPalette
member.summary: The full palette object.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.EditPaletteDialog.#ctor
member.summary: Start a new palette.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.EditPaletteDialog.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Load and edit palette from file.
member.param: Location of color palette file, including full path + filename + extension.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.EditPaletteDialog.#ctor(WithoutHaste.Drawing.Colors.ColorPalette)
member.summary: Edit the provided palette.
member.remarks: The provided palette object will be updated directly. The user will not be prompted to save the palette to a file.

member.name: T:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.History
member.summary: Data structure for managing redo/undo operations.
member.remarks:
Usage:
Create one instance of a History for your application.
Create an IHistoryAction for each unique action in your application.
Add a new IHistoryAction to the History for each user action.
Call Undo and Redo to undo/redo user actions.

member.name: P:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.History.IsOn
member.summary: New actions will not be added to History when it is turned off.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.History.On
member.summary: Turn history on. New actions will be saved.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.History.Off
member.summary: Turn history off. New actions will not be saved, but Undo and Redo will still work.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.History.Add(WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.IHistoryAction)
member.summary: Add new action to the history. Clears the Redo list.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.History.Undo
member.summary: Undo an action. Calls IHistoryAction.Undo().
member.remarks: Does nothing if there is no action to undo.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.History.Redo
member.summary: Redo an action. Calls IHistoryAction.Do().
member.remarks: Does nothing if there is no action to redo.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.History.Clear
member.summary: Clear history.

member.name: T:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.HistoryActionGroup
member.summary: An that groups actions that must be undone/redone as a set.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.HistoryActionGroup.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.IHistoryAction})
member.summary: Initialize group with an ordered list of actions.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.HistoryActionGroup.Add(WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.IHistoryAction)
member.summary: Add an action to the end of the ordered list.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.HistoryActionGroup.Do
member.summary: Redo grouped actions in normal order.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.HistoryActionGroup.Undo
member.summary: Undo grouped actions in reverse order.

member.name: T:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.IHistoryAction
member.summary: An action that can be managed by a object.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.IHistoryAction.Do
member.summary: Action to run on "redo".

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.IHistoryAction.Undo
member.summary: Action to run on "undo".

member.name: T:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.ImageHelper
member.summary: Utilities related to image processing.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.ImageHelper.SafeLoadBitmap(System.String)

summary.para: To avoid "A generic error occurred in GDI+" exception.

GDI+ expects the original MemoryStream used to load an image to remain open for the full life of the image. If you close the MemoryStream and then try to save the image to the same location as it was loaded from, you'll get this exception.
Opening images with this method will avoid that error.

member.param: Full path and filename to image.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.ImageHelper.GetThumbnail(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Shrinks an image to fit within and . Keeps aspect ratio the same.
member.returns: Returns a new Bitmap object, even if the image did not need to be resized.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.ImageHelper.GetCursorPos(System.Drawing.Point@)
member.summary: Used by .

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.ImageHelper.BitBlt(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Used by .

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.ImageHelper.GetColorFromScreen(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Returns the color of a pixel from the screen.

member.name: T:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutHelper
member.summary: Helper for placing and sizing controls in a Form relative to each other.

remarks.para: Uses method chaining for a fluent writing style. Location and sizing methods can be chained in any order. Apply must be the last command.
Add the control to its parent after using LayoutHelper.
All methods in can also be called on LayoutHelper.

member.name: F:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutHelper.AnchorAll
member.summary: Control.Anchor setting for anchoring in all directions.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutHelper.PlaceRightOf(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Place control directly to the right of the reference, aligned to the top of the reference.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutHelper.PlaceRightOf(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Int32)
member.summary: Place control directly to the right of the reference, aligned to the top of the reference, with margin in between.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutHelper.PlaceLeftOf(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Place control directly to the left of the reference, aligned to the top of the reference.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutHelper.PlaceLeftOf(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Int32)
member.summary: Place control directly to the left of the reference, aligned to the top of the reference, with margin in between.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutHelper.CenterVertically(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Center control vertically inside reference.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutHelper.CenterHorizontally(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Center control horizontally inside reference.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutHelper.CenterBoth(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Center control horizontally and vertically inside reference.

member.name: M:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutHelper.CenterBothInScreen(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Center control horizontally and vertically inside reference, within the screen.

member.name: T:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutOptions
member.summary: These operations are intended to be used from .
member.remarks: This object will collect commands for how to position and size a control, and then apply those commands all at once.

member.name: T:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutOptions.MeasureType
member.summary: Ways of defining a measurement.

member.name: F:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutOptions.MeasureType.Absolute
member.summary: Measurement is exact.

member.name: F:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutOptions.MeasureType.Match
member.summary: Measurement matches a reference value.

member.name: T:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutOptions.PositionType
member.summary: Ways of defining a position relative to another item.

member.name: F:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutOptions.PositionType.InAbsolute
member.summary: Position is based on ReferenceControl.ClientSize edges.

member.name: F:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutOptions.PositionType.InFloat
member.summary: Works Like HTML float. Position is based on Controls already in ReferenceControl.
member.example: Float left means place this to the right of the left-most control in the reference.

member.name: F:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutOptions.PositionType.Match
member.summary: Exactly match the position of the reference.
member.example: MatchLeft means use same Left location as the reference control.

member.name: F:WithoutHaste.Windows.GUI.LayoutOptions.PositionType.NextTo
member.summary: Place this control next to the reference.

member.summary: Place at top of reference with this margin.
